page.title: 07TRANSPORT
page.content: TRANSPORT IN THE STAUNTON ON WYE Travellers in the Staunton on Wye area must depend either on private transport or on the local bus service. Yeomans provide a bus into Hereford each morning at 8, with returns at 4.30 & 6pm. A recent innovation is the pull-in by Tesco's in Hereford, much appreciated by elderly shoppers. The fares are reasonable at 65p from Staunton to Hereford with conces- sionary tokens for pensioners. Many families have their own cars an anyone living out of the main village needs a car. Roads are often bad in winter with little gritting and snow left uncleared for days even on the main road. Walking on the main road is always ddangerous because of the volume and speed of traffic.
